content: Red Bull pulled in Germany after cocaine test BERLIN - Six German states have told retailers to stop selling Red Bull Cola energy drinks after a test found a trace amount of cocaine. The bans started Friday after a sample test conducted by authorities in North Rhine-Westphalia state found 0.4 micrograms per liter in the drink. Five other states also banned it from shops amid concerns over possible narcotics law violations. Read more at >>> >>>http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/30929880/
reply: Red Bull pulled in Germany after cocaine test BERLIN - Six German states have told retailers to stop selling Red Bull Cola energy drinks after a test found a trace amount of cocaine. The bans started Friday after a sample test conducted by authorities in North Rhine-Westphalia state found 0.4 micrograms per liter in the drink. Five other states also banned it from shops amid concerns over possible narcotics law violations. Read more at >>> >>>http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/30929880/
title: Red Bull pulled in Germany after cocaine test

content: Anybody notice a proliferation of energy drinks at the gas bars and milk stores? The $2.99 'shooter' section in our local has crowded out the candy bars. We need pick-me-ups like this all of a sudden? Can you spell g-e-t-t-i-n-g a b-u-z-z?
